description:
This UNO special edition features the characters from the Studio Ghibli film "My Neighbor Totoro"! Cards feature pictures of Mei, Satsuki and Totoro along with other characters from the movie.

The game contains 112 cards. 25 each of four colour sets (red, green, yellow, blue - 1 x 0 card, 2 x number cards 2 to 9, 2 x Reverse, 2 x Skip, 2 x Draw 2) plus 4 of three wild card types (Wild, Wild Draw 4, Sanbo Wild)

The game plays like a standard game of UNO with only one exception. The Sanbo Wild, or "Walk" card, is exclusive to this version of UNO - when played each player must give their hand to the next clockwise player. The person who played the card then chooses the colour. If drawn as the first card it should be returned to the deck and a new card drawn.

In Mathemagician's Duel, players create "incanquations" from the cards in their hands to cast spells on their opponent, to reduce the opponent's Magical Strength to 0.

The incanquations are created by playing Magical Energy cards (numerals) and Magical Symbols cards (operators) so that when read left to right add up to the casting value of the chosen spell. Each spell when successfully cast, reduces the opponent's Magical Strength by a certain amount.

The game helps players practice mental math skills and working memory as they calculate the value of their own and their opponent's incanquations.

—description from the publisher

Four pictures have one word in common - which one is it? Since 4 Bilder 1 Wort – Das Kartenspiel, players can puzzle not only in the app of the same name, but also together at the gaming table. With 4 Bilder 1 Wort - Neue Herausforderungen 140 new puzzles come into play - for even more fun!

4 Bilder 1 Wort - Neue Herausforderungen provides owners of 4 Bilder 1 Wort – Das Kartenspiel as well as newcomers new long-lasting gaming fun.

The bookworm thought of something new to test the knowledge of his potential successors: Dice define the letters for which players have to create words. Players can get the dice from the middle or steal them from other players. Theme cards specify the category. A special die causes turbulences as it provides bonus points, minus points or a new theme.

Bookworm: The Dice Game maintains the reliable game principle but the dice cause way more rotation. The cards also can be used for the original Bookworm game.

Zombicide, the board game, has taken the world by storm with over two million copies sold since its release in 2012 and spawning a cult franchise of cooperative zombie slaying all over the world. In Zombicide, zombies are controlled by the game, while players take on the role of survivors who must co-operate in order to survive and thrive in a world overrun by the bloodthirsty undead. Find guns and gear to take the fight to the zombies through 25 different scenarios linked by a branching story as you pick your way through an infested city.

Zombicide (2nd Edition) features refined and streamlined rules, including updates to target priority for ranged attacks, interactions with doors, and vehicle mechanisms.  A new dark zone feature, a zone that hides zombies from survivor's attacks, has been added as well. Zombicide (2nd Edition) will include new components and miniatures as well, including plastic dashboards and new child survivors. Returning players will be able to use their existing collection from previous Zombicide releases as well.

The most complete geography card game in the world. It includes all 194 countries and a world map. The basic game is to compete with facts between world countries (a bigger country beats a smaller one, etc.). There are also 4 possible challenges: Flag, Location, the Capital City and a Continent challenge.

Rosetta: The Lost Language is a co-operative judgement game for two or more players.

In the game, players take on the role of experts who try to understand the written language of the author, a player who represents a lost individual, community, or civilization. The author assigns meaning to an inscription that is written in a fictional script, and the experts must figure out what that meaning is. The experts choose a word as a guess, and the author translates it into the given script, informing their understanding of the writing system. This goes back and forth until the experts give a word that is translated into the original inscription. The number of guesses represents a score, with players seeking the lowest score possible.

Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the British Mosquito fighter-bomber variant.

In addition to the Mosquito FB VI (fighter-bomber variant), this set also includes:


     Mosquito Mk. XVII Tsetse (anti-shipping variant with 57mm cannon)
     Mosquito NF VI (radar-equipped night fighter variant)
     V-1 Buzz bomb
     ground target for Amiens Prison
     Ship targets for verpostenboot, sperrbrecher, and Type VIIC U-boat
     Bomb hit markers
     Barrage balloon clusters
     Flak circles


This set contains four scenarios.

Intruder:  Night-fighter versions of the Mosquito raid a Luftwaffe airfield at night. Returning Ju-88 bombers are prey, but a Bf-110G night fighter defends.

Operation Jericho: Free French prisoners from the Gestapo by knocking down the prison walls. Fw-190A fighters from a nearby airfield counter-attack.

Operation Crossbow: Intercept V-1 flying bombs before they strike British targets.

Mosquito Bites: Tsetse anti-shipping variants of the Mosquito attack a surfaced U-boat as it transitions though the Bay of Biscay.

—description from the publisher

Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The Bf-110 was ineffective as an escort fighter but served as an exceptional night fighter. The twin-engine design allowed radar set to be installed in the nose.  This was operated by the second crewman, who also operated the tail gun. This set contains the BF-110G4, the definitive Zerstroyer night fighter. Also included is the Bf-110G2, a daylight heavy fighter which trades the high-drag radar antenna for a higher maximum speed.

This set is a self-contained rulebook with miniatures for the Bf-110G and four scenarios.

Viermot: Engage a daylight raid of B-17 Flying Fortresses with air-to-air rockets. P-47 Thunderbolts escort the bombers.

Schrade Music: Attack a formation of Lancaster bombers at night using upward-firing cannon.

Jabo vs. Jabo:  Engage Il-2 and Yak-7 while protecting tanks on the Russian Front.

Zahme Sau:  Bf-110 and Bf-109G night fighters use spotlights to engage a regenerating stream of Lancaster bombers.

—description from the publisher

Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. Each ruleset is a self-contained game including cut-out miniatures of one aircraft and a set of rules. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.

Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The B-25H was an armoured strafer version of the B-25. The bombardier's position was replaced with a 75mm field cannon, the glazed nose was replaced with armour plating, and an additional four .50 machine guns were installed. B-25H aircraft engaged in anti-shipping and low-level strafing.
 This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the B-25H and contains four scenarios that may reference other aircraft:

Destroyer: A single B-25H element engages a gun duel against a Japanese destroyer.

Convoy: Attack a Japanese supply convoy.

Wewak: Fight A6M5 Zero fighters while skip-bombing Japanese shipping

Rabaul: Strafe a heavily-defended Japanese airfield using parafrag bombs. Heavy AAA fire and continually-spawning A6M5 Zero fighters threaten to overwhelm the strafers.

New rules include: 

     AAA positions: Land-based guns that guard targets.
     Flak suppression:  Heavy maching gun fire can temporarily stop a ship or AAA position from firing.
     Parafrags:  Small fragmentation bombs that are used at low altitudes.


New targets include:

     Kagero-class Japanese destroyer
     Japanese cargo ship
     Japanese airfield
     AAA positions


—description from the publisher

Adidoku is a new generation of puzzles with a fun mix of characters, places and phrases. Guess the connections and stimulate your brain !

To resolve Adidoku (puzzle), distribute on a table all the pieces showing the "Arts" tiles side. Connect the pieces by checking the words and phrases that seem related. For example: connect "Freddy" with "Mercury" or "Frida" with "Kahlo".

"Palabretas" Mini game included. In Palabretas you compete to make 4 words before the others and achieve the highest number of points! You can use each image as one or several letters. Use an ICE to create dICE, or EAT to create mEAT, or BOot to create BOss. Increase your points with colors, hearts or clovers.

A game without turns and unexpected combinations!

It‘s dusty, hot and dry. The Serengeti is no desert, but in the summer, especially when the rain stays off, it is essential to provide enough water for the people and cattle herds.

The village community voted that a new well is required, for the next dry season will be harder than ever before. Smart people with knowledge about the vast savanna and the ability to find water and clay deposits are called to build the best well.

This task is difficult enough, but the wild buffaloes are also interested in the waterholes and they do not hesitate to destroy the wells under construction.

Maji is an abstract strategy game for two well-builders from 10 years played on a 5x5 grid of Serengeti tiles, which show adobe bricks, buffaloes or waterholes. The goal is to finish a well consisting of six well pieces and gather enough water gems, before the other player does.

—description from the designer

Sudoku and board games are combined in Numberplace City.

You are the president of a construction company that undertook the construction of an undersea city. We will build the buildings at the same time as our rivals, but we cannot build the same building in the same column, the same row, and the same block.

After you have built the minimum number of buildings, you can use various effects. Some of the effects include taking the start player marker, spinning the board, or winning the game.

Well, who is the best architect?

A simple roll-and-move game designed for children who are unable to read, but are able to tell different colors apart. Gameplay resembles a simplified version of Candyland: Players select a colored movement pawn, then take turns rolling a die with various colors represented on it to see where they move their pawn.  The player who reaches the end of the path first wins.

NFL Trade$ Card Game is a fast paced card game where the goal is to grab the best combination of top picks as they rush by. Score big by making combos of player positions, teams and division. Acquire the top pick before your opponent to build a higher scoring team. Gather the most points and become the ultimate Trade$ winner!

—description from the designer

When 2 dogs broke into the Boneyard, the Skeleton's bones were scattered and lost. Compete with your friends to find and rebuild the Skeletons while the Dogs roam the Boneyard looking for something to chew on.

The game takes place on a 2 layer, 4x4 grid of tiles. On your turn you will flip tiles and look for Bones. There are 10 Skeletons and each has 3 Bones. You will earn points by combining the Bones in matching or mixed sets, and in sets of 2 or 3 Bones. End your turn by moving the Dog tiles and blocking the next player from specific bones. By the end of the game, the player with the highest score of assembled Skeletons wins.

—description from the designer

The Gobblers family has organized their traditional hide-and-seek party! The mums hide the teenagers, and the teenagers hide the babies! You will need to rely on memory and observation to help you find them in Gobblers Family Mix. Flip a card and be the first to deduce the missing Gobblers and to find it! Beware of the Great-Aunt and Great-Uncle who are the king and queen of troubles...

—description from the publisher

In 532, Buddhism arrived in Japan, and took its place alongside Shintoism, which is the official religion. Prince Shotoku, seduced by this new religion, commissioned Buddhist monks to construct a village endowed with an immense garden, in which 8 pagodas (tajuto) would be erected. He announced that once the fourth tajuto was complete, it would make this city an important pilgrimage destination for all Buddhists around the world. The Buddhist monk who has attained the highest level of Spirituality, through deep Meditation and other mental qualities, at this precise moment will be rewarded, and the Prince will name them "Great Guardian of the Sacred Garden of the Eight Pagodas", and this monk will become the overseer of pilgrimage.

In Tajuto, players take on the roles of the Buddhist monks, trying to achieve the highest spirituality. On their turn, they can activate their action tiles to draw (and build) pagoda tiles from the bag, make offerings to gain meditation points, and acquire tiles that will help them progress more quickly or earn them spirituality points. Activating more than one action tile or acquiring tiles costs meditation points. The game ends once the fourth pagoda is finished. The player with the most spirituality points wins.

The key feature of the game is drawing the pagoda tiles from the bag. The pagoda tiles have a decreasing size per level. Players are welcome to blindly rummage around to try to recognize the floor by its size, but they aren’t likely to be able to detect the color this way, so drawing the floor size they want depends on their tactile recognition, but they have to weigh their odds to draw the color they want.

—description from the publisher

The players have to get their pawn from space 1 to space 300. Movement is determined by a spinner. The spinner indicates two numbers, wich are added to determine the number of spaces, the pawn has to move forward. If a pawn gets on a space with a picture and an arithmetical task (based on the number of the space), the meeple has to be moved forwards or backwards accordingly. The first player to reach space 300 wins the game.

—user summary

Is it a bird? is it a plane? Is it my husband with the rubber gloves? No, it is SUPERLEMMING!

The lemmings want to jump off the cliffs! But Superlemming hurries to rescue them... he will turn a blind eye only on his friends... :)

Superlemming is a fast and funny card game for 2-5 players. Each of you wants to have their lemmings jump off the cliffs as efficiently as possible. But each player is also a Superlemming who cannot stand still if another lemming is in danger and saves it from jumping off the cliffs. Only for their friends they take it easy...

—description from the publisher

Race your opponent as you attempt to catapult all the squishy fish through the center of the game board. But you better work fast… the first player to launch all fish to their opponent’s side wins. It will require speed, accuracy and concentration if you want to be the king of the ocean.

Lab Rats is a push your luck party game where the player take the role of a lab rat and must escape from a collapsing laboratory. The goal of the game is to collect four cheese tokens.

At the start of every round the players receive door cards(to create the laboratory) and potion cards (to pass obstacles).
In each round the player must open doors and face what lies behind them. The doors are represented by face down cards played by all the players in the middle of the table. Each of these cards contains an obstacle or event that must be resolved by the active player when the card is tapped.

Most of the obstacles are resolved by playing the potion card that matches the obstacle. When a player flip an obstacle card that he can't resolve, the rat takes a wound. On a second wound the rat will die and by out of the round.

After resolving any door the player can end his turn and collect the rewards. He collect 1 yellow chit for each door card face up and 1 green chit for each door card face down. The yellow chit can be traded for cheese tokens and the green chit represent the rats being poisoned by the lab and will die if they take too much!

Have you always wanted glory, wealth and victories? Here is your time!

Fantasy Crystals is coming, and with it comes a plethora of heroes you can lead to triumph in epic clashes! Seize the opportunity to embark on a fantastic land full of riches and irrepressible rivals. Don't hesitate. Stand up to fight! The winner takes all!

Fantasy Crystals is a card game for two to four people with a dedicated solo mode. Players choose their champions from among the wealth-hungry adventurers to measure themselves in constant duels for crystals and glory. Players must use cunning and cool calculation to create their unique tactics and challenge the world.

Everything you need to play our game from two to four players, as well as a solo mode! The game includes 2 identical decks, which differ only in symbols. A 2-player game requires only 1 deck to play, for a 3- and 4-player game you need 2 decks.

—description from the publisher

Introduction:

You are a conspiracy theorist.
Your goal is to get the highest number of followers on your conspiracy blog, no matter the cost.
Create attention-grabbing blog headlines, influence world events, and sabotage your competition.

Summary:

Cardspiracy is a 4 to 6 player social-strategy card game where players compete to attract the most followers by creating viral headlines on their conspiracy blog.

Headlines can be augmented or undermined by events and actions. Prior to scoring, players vote for their favourite conspiracy and assign followers to reward creativity. If they play to the strengths of their secret identity, it could mean a big boost of followers at the end of the game.
Can you grow the biggest following, or are you doomed to obscurity?

Features:

     Two Games in One - A simplified Party-Mode focused on building conspiracies removes strategic elements from the game to allow expanded player count (4 - 8 players)
     High replayability - With over 500,000 Conspiracy Combinations
     Combined Social and Strategy - Gameplay rewards creativity and encourages long term planning


—description from the publisher

Rival warbands battle for territory and influence amidst the Chaos-corrupted wastes of the Eightpoints!

Enter the dark world of Warcry in the Core Book – your guide to skirmish combat in the Mortal Realms and the dark world of the Eightpoints. This book contains the core rules for Warcry, plus expansion options for open, narrative and matched play. Forge your legend with campaigns for 9 Chaos warbands and 9 Warbands hailing from other grand alliances, discover how to grow and develop your warband between battles, and explore the heart of Archaon’s kingdoms with sumptuous art and dark lore that provides an all-new perspective on Chaos.

If you're looking to start exploring the world of the Eightpoints and playing Warcry, this is your essential companion.

This book contains:

     The complete core rules for Warcry, allowing you to play the game
     Rules for open play, including two types of multiplayer battles for 3 or more players – Coalition of Death and Triumph & Treachery
     Rules for matched play, including guidelines to balancing your battleplans and advice on how to run a tournament
     Rules for narrative play that allow you to run thrilling campaigns and forge epic stories where your warband progresses in power and notoriety
     A campaign section, featuring campaign quests for a number of Warcry factions, plus name generation tables for creating your warbands.


—description from the publisher

The first set for Legendary Endeavors CCG. Nightmare set is a survival horror collectible card game. Bringing together human survivors, demons, monsters, creatures, zombies and more.
The game play is fast and done with dice to add the randomness of combat. By creating decks or using one of several methods the Players are tasked with being the last Player with Character Cards alive. Game Play usually takes 20-30 minutes with the Starter Deck. The overlaying goal is to use all cards until only one player is standing.

—description from the designer

The $100,000 Pyramid DVD game is fast-paced and easy-to-play - just pop it into your DVD player and try to top the Pyramid!

Like real game show contestants, you shout out clues for your teammates while they try to guess their way through a maze of challenging and humorous categories. Whether you're giving clues or guessing answers, you've got to think fast and talk fast to reach the Winners Circle!

—description from the back of the box

In the East of the island of Sicily lived a man named Cremete (similar to Radagast of Lotr), he controlled the animals in the lost woods; this man managed to impress King Roger II (1095 - 1154). In the west of the island of Sicily there lived a wolf (now extinct): the Canis Lupus Cristaldii, a large and fast, lethal blond wolf. This is true the story of a Wolf and a man who lived in the deep European Middle Ages: do you want to be part of it? Nebrodensis is the name of the Sicilian mountains and in this enchanted island the game develops on 8 abstract games 1vs1 (or 1vs2) or other in 8 solitaire games; symmetrical and asymmetrical, strategic and aleatory, german and american, nocturnal or diurnal, pushed into a psychological wood where only fangs and magic win. The only way to survive is to become an extinct Wolf or a magical Hermit really existed: do you accept the challenge or are you too afraid of the moon?

—description from the publisher

Two Khans is a quick hidden identity and deduction game based on intelligence, accuracy and quick awareness.

In this game time is against you and each player only knows the identity of ONE other player. Now it’s up to players to figure out who’s who and find their way to find Khans. Whichever team first finds and kills the other team’s Khan, wins.

Story: The story goes back to thousands years ago in Persia, where the king is dying and has no relative successor to take the throne. If the king dies, his Senior Minister will take the throne but the problem is that the king does not trust any of his staff, specially the Senior Minister! So he writes two secret letter to the two famous khans of north and south, explaining the reason and inviting them to his palace…

Based on the already popular games Doubt, Cheat, and Bullshit, BS Button Game is a shedding game for 2-6 players.  The deck contains 52 standard playing cards featuring original art, two jokers, and two bureaucrats.  Any player can call a bluff by pushing the BS Button which flashes red and calls bullshit with one of 60 random celebrity impressions.

The joker and bureaucrat cards allow play with as few as two players.

Jokers and bureaucrats are wild.  Additionally, any player who holds a bureaucrat and has incorrectly called a bluff or has been called on a bad bluff can play the bureaucrat and override the call.  Whoever plays the bureaucrat redetermines the next card and plays it.

Play continues until one player discards every card while avoiding a valid call of bullshit.

—description from the publisher
Using the Tip-Toi system, hunt for missing animal tiles by playing a variety of minigames put forward by the dragon.

Raging Kingdoms is a medieval-themed real-time strategy (RTS) inspired board game.

Command one of history’s great kingdoms and lead it to victory through skillful economic development, technological advancement, and, of course, the art of war!

Raging Kingdoms is a game for one to six players. A typical game takes 90 to 120 minutes.

Win by conquering all enemy empires, or by leaving them in awe of your Wonder Victory. Each turn, you'll roll a special die for your action moves. Make the most of your action moves to march closer to your goal.


     Create new units - villagers to gather resources, scouts to discover the hidden map, or swordsmen, archers and knights to crush threatening neighbors.
     Construct new buildings - camps to exploit resources, blacksmiths to equip your army, and towers to defend against aggressive opponents.
     Research new technologies to help your empire reach new heights.
     Devise the perfect attack to conquer new land and show your enemies your rage!


At the end of your turn, collect the resources your villagers have gathered for you and start planning your next moves!

Highlights:

     Immersive: Play as exciting historical civilizations like the Romans, Vikings, Mongols, and more!
     RTS Appeal: Intuitive for fans of classic medieval real-time strategy (RTS) games!
     Replayability: Newly generated map to discover each game, exciting game variants, single player and multiplayer campaigns!


Raging Kingdoms delivers in a tabletop game all the best parts of classic RTS video games, like:

     A randomly generated map that players discover, making each game different
     Managing the gathering and stockpiling of 4 resources
     Finding the perfect balance between reinvesting in your economy, strengthening your military, and researching new technology
     Choosing which military units will be most effective in which battle situations
     Strategically deciding when, where, and how to strike your opponents
     Tactically commanding units to lead them to victory


—description from the publisher

Dimes is a party game that tests your ability to read the minds of your friends.

Using a Dimes card you'll present a friend with an either/or question. All the remaining players will try to guess which item that player prefers. Players are rewarded for successfully reading other players' minds.

The game is easily adapted as a drinking game and is ideal for party/social settings

—description from the publisher

Goodbye Trivia, hello D.I.N.K. game. The game of the 1990's is here! Introducing new and exciting concepts. Guaranteed to known your socks off! You're given the opportunity to become a real life D.I.N.K. created by strategic moves, lucky dice rolling, and plain ol' good fun. It's exciting and fast paced.
—description from the publisher

Look out Yuppies, the D.I.N.K.S. have arrived! The Baby Boomers second generation is here! Once family-bound, now striving for Double Income No Kids. The combination of two incomes allows D.I.N.K.s to live the upper class lifestyle. . . .

The object of the D.I.N.K. Game is to live and acquire materialistic objects like a real live D.I.N.K. The Double Income will allow this between you and your spouse, by playing in teams and working together. Therefore the winner of the game is the first team to acquire the complete the D.I.N.K. Checklist, accumulating at least 40 points and acquiring $250,000 in the bank.
—description from the rulebook

May also be played in the S.I.N.K. version (SINGLE INCOME NO KIDS). Same rules apply but there is only a single income.
—from a note on the inside of the box

D.I.N.K. = Double Income No Kids

… SEVENEL is the future! SEVENEL has all those multiple choice questions everyone prefers. SEVENEL has no dice and we offer each player the opportunity to "Jump-In" on other people's questions. In addition, SEVENEL has more strategy than we can possibly explain. Using 7 different playing surfaces we have eliminated that dizzy feeling as well as "board boredom". Finally, if you do fall asleep, your opponents will be thrilled because they will surely benefit!

These are a few of the advantages the future holds for you with SEVENEL. We want you to experience the challenges we have discovered while playing the most versatile game of our time. And, there is no right or wrong way to play SEVENEL - you create your own version each time you play.

As you see, the history of trivia games promises to be much better as . . .

"night after night
        we play into the future!"

—description from the publisher

In this Adidoku, designed for CHILDREN 8 years and older, they will guess connections of words and concepts, developing language, concentration and organization skills. More than 500 halves of concepts and phrases to assemble the image of a large mosaic with Frankenstein, Medusa, Dracula, Skull, Witch and Fairy.

Inside the box, you will also find a completely different game, called Crucibujos (from the creators of Adigma).

"Crucibujos" 
Can you be the first to form a line of 5 images of your color with your pieces, connected by one of the Crucibujos strokes But be careful, players can capture your pieces!
Detect which images will give you more advantage and build your strategy.

Stillsee is a detective game in which you get a set of evidence and need to decide who is the criminal. You get a set of physical objects in combination with digital parts and use them for the investigation. At the end of the process, players need to enter the name of the criminal and it will be validated if it's correct. It's also possible to get hints that will help you find the right solution.

The game can played in a co-operative mode as well as in a competitive mode with players split into teams and competing to see who will find the criminal first.

The game is designed as a realistic criminal case and requires investigations similar to those carried out by the Criminal Police in real life.

•••

Ein Fußballspieler aus Russland, der unter merkwürdigen Umständen nach Deutschland gekommen ist, wird tot in einem See gefunden. War es ein Unfall? Oder wurde er ermordet?

Das Spiel ist als realistischer Kriminalfall ausgedacht und erfordert Untersuchungen ähnlich denen, die von der Kriminalpolizei im wirklichen Leben durchgeführt werden.

Cannibal Collective is a party game for people who have a strong stomach.

The premise of the game is simple, you have been invited to the 58th Annual Cannibal Collective initiation dinner and as part of the initiation you have to collect the very best bodyparts to comprise your meal.

The first person to collect 1 of each of the 7 body part cards is the winner.

But be warned! There are many other aspects at play! These include The Platypus of Doom, Mystic Lamp Wizards, Assassins, Cloaks of Invisibility, Martians, Zombies, Ninjas, Vampires, Psychics, Leprosy, Magicians, Chainsaws and more.

You collect the body parts by using attack cards and wildcards to steal them from other players, as well as picking them up from the deck. You lose body parts when other players attack you, though you can use defence cards and wildcards to stop other player's attacks.

Wildcards include the Magician card, where a player leaves the room and a card is hidden. They then have to find it and if they can't they lose 3 body parts.

The game takes roughly 20 minutes to play but gets quicker as it progresses as the number of body parts in the deck dwindles.

Each player can play as many cards as they want during their turn and ends their go when they pick up a card.

—description from the designer

Explore Xeo and discover buried riches. Collect money, keys and the coveted golden treasures! If Exis attacks, you could lose everything!


     Play Cards to explore map
     Reveal the buried surprise
     Don't let Exis steal your treasures


—description from the publisher

During one of the toughest battles fought in World War 2: the Battle of the Bulge, you face the difficult task to conquer important streets in the Belgian city of Bastogne.

In Clash of the Ardennes you have control over the Allied or Axis forces and you have to obtain your goal, which is described on your 'Objective card' (drawn at the beginning of the game).

Use all of your (special) units wisely, because you will run out of units very quickly. Place them strategically and tactically on 1 of the 7 streets, always think ahead and try to reach your objective a little bit sooner than your opponent.

—description from the designer

At last you can make the news! Bluff your way to the top and win fame and fortune by creating your own sensational mind-boggling Headlines. Play H.O.T., the wildly entertaining game that contains all the thrills of a roller coaster ride. H.O.T. is a hilarious, nail-biting adventure that gives you the chance to scoop incredible and outrageous Headlines of your own.

If you convince the other players that your phony headlines are authentic, then you can fib first to the finish to become a billionaire Tabloid Tycoon. Expose the lurid lifestyles of the rich and famous! Uncover sexy scandalous secrets! Investigate mysteries that defy the logic of science! Play H.O.T., the HEADLINES ON TABLOIDS game and experience an excitement you will never forget!!!

—description from the publisher

The Ludik Quebec Alice Board Game is a game of observation and speed for children 6 years and older. This game is designed with beautiful illustrations of the characters from the tale of Alice in Wonderland. The first player who finds the identical characters and exhausts all the cards in his deck as soon as possible wins the game! A simple and fun game that will appeal to your youngest!

Getting Ready: 

     A player shuffles the cards ad separates them into two equal piles
     Players sit in front of each other, take their pile of cards and put it face down in front of them
     Using the discs they make two columns of four discs each face up, leaving a space between columns large enough to contain four cards side by side.


Playing the game:
The game goes on until one of the players plays out his entire pile of cards.
Each turn is comprised of four steps, each one starting the same way
Players count to three, take the top card of their own pile and put it simultaneously in front of their opponents turned card. 
As soon as their cards are turned, players must be quick to locate identical cards. If there are no identical cards on the playing area, players move to the next step.

When there are two identical cards on the playing area, the first player to hit the disc matching the character on them taes a card from his own pile and covers one of the identical cards.
Players move on to the next step only when there are no identical cards on the playing area.

Note: Identical cards may be found in any column, not necessarily facing each other. In that case, players proceed in the same way. The player who is the quickest to hit the right disc covers one of the identical cards using a card from his own pile.

The first player to play the last card on his pile wins the game.

—user summary

In Influencer, players take on the roles of wannabe influencers, chasing moments in real life not for the experience but instead for the social power of posting them later. Not every moment will prove to be popular though, as players watch the trending topics change round after round. Whoever can build their timeline in a way that attracts the most followers by the end of the game is the winner – though regardless of the outcome, the players may find out they’re all still wannabe influencers in the end!

Gameplay of Influencer is incredibly simple. Players collect cards resembling social media posts which have an image, a description, and different thematic categories (such as Gaming, Sports, Fashion, Health, Travel, etc.). Players draft cards from an open area each round with the final, unselected card becoming the trending topic (thematically this is to say that no matter what the players end up posting there is always something cooler than all of them… they are wannabe influencers after all!). After drafting players add a card from their hand to their feed (a row of cards in front of them). They then score based on chaining categories together (such as 3 Food posts in a row) and also earn points for matching the trending topic. As rounds proceed players remove cards from the end of their feed, placing them in their discard, making only their most relevant posts matter.

A casual, filler game, learned in minutes, Influencer is a lightweight experience that allows its designer, Peter Jürgensen, to play with humor and satire regarding a topic that many people can relate to.

—description from the publisher

School of Sorcery is a reimplementation and revision of The Institute for Magical Arts. The game contains many of the same game mechanisms, but with a number of new rules changes.  Some of the components have also been upgraded and the card powers have almost all changed.  It also introduces a number of new cards with a variety of powers.

Collect powerful magical items and build friendships to build your reputation at the School of Sorcery.

School of Sorcery is a two-player dice and area control game in which players use dice rolls to place "crystals" onto different cards in an attempt to win those cards. Once won, cards offer either special powers or victory points or both.

—description from the designer

Ramo is a game that has the best parts from Contract Rummy, Mahjong and Uno combined, hence the name RAMO.

The object of the game is to have the least amount of points after playing the 8th level.

For each hand, each player's object is to complete and lay down his/her current level’s requirement, and then rid their hand of remaining cards by discarding them on laid-down levels, called "expanding". The player who does this first wins the hand and scores minus fifty; all other players earn penalty points according to the value of cards remaining in their hand.

In each round the players reduce the value of the cards held in their hands by laying on the table those cards that fit the requirement of his/her own level which consists of Sets and Runs.


     A Set consists of three or four cards, all different colored
     A Run consists of three or more cards in sequence, all same colored 
     The 13th card can be used in the middle when making Runs (eg: 12-13-1)


There are 60 cards in one deck, and two decks are used in a 3 or 5-player game, three decks for more players:

     52 numbered cards: each valued from 1 to 13, in four different colors. 
     two Wild cards
     one Skip card
     one -1 card
     two x2 cards
     one +3 card 
     one ? card


The Deal

The first player (dealer) shuffles the deck and before dealing, the next player “cuts” the deck, the dealer then deals 13 cards to the next player, and 12 cards to the rest of the players, the remaining cards are placed face down in the center of the table to form the Draw Deck, the player with the 13 cards in hand discards one card from his/her hand to start a Discard Pile, then the game continues counter-clockwise.

Gameplay

On each turn, a player:

     Draws either the face-up top card of the Discard Pile or one card from the deck.
     May lay down their completed round-appropriate collection of Sets and Runs.
     May play off other players who have laid down once they have laid down themselves.
     May discard one card from their hand onto the discard pile. When a player discards a card that could have been played off on their own or another player's laid cards is a "Ramo". Only players that are LAID DOWN may call out Ramo. The FIRST player to call Ramo must take the discarded one card to make a new Set or Run, or expand any laid down cards in the game even if it’s not his/her turn. The regular counter-clockwise order of turns may be interrupted for Ramo if the player who calls Ramo is not directly after the discarder (in order of play), one or two players will essentially miss their turn as play continues counter-clockwise from the player who calls Ramo. If multiple players call Ramo for a discarded card, priority for the discard goes to the player who calls out Ramo first. 


Play continues, in alternating turns, until one player goes out, or has no cards left in their hand. A player goes out when he successfully discards the only remaining card in hand, marking the conclusion of the step for all players.

It is customary to announce other players when there is only one card left in your hand. This alerts other players of closeness to going out. Points are tallied and recorded by a score-keeper. All of the cards are shuffled and the next round of play commences. Whoever has the most amount of scores (penalties), deals the next round (Level).

Level requirements:

     two sets
     one set and one run
     two runs
     three sets
     two sets and one run
     one set and two runs
     three runs
     four sets or four runs


Scoring:
Five points for each card remaining in hand with value 1-9
Ten points for each card remaining in hand with value 10-13
Twenty points for each Special Card remaining in hand

—description from the designer

Quick! Help your frogs cross the pond! Roll your dice to make them jump from one water lily to another. Be careful! If you pass an opponent’s frog, there is a battle. The loser returns to the start space. The first player to reach their frog-filled pond is declared the winner. This game develops motor skills and promotes the learning of numbers.

—description from the publisher
